title: RNN vs. CNN vs. Autoencoder vs. Attention/Transformer
excerpt: A practical guide to various deep learning architectures, including Recurrent Neural Networks (RNNs), Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs), Autoencoders, and Attention/Transformer models, with examples and use cases.

title: AI Engineering: RAG and Agents
excerpt: Detailed exploration of Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) and AI agents, covering definitions, workflows, tools, planning, control flows, and memory management in AI applications.

title: AI Engineering: Prompt Engineering
excerpt: An in-depth look at prompt engineering, discussing its importance in guiding AI models, the anatomy of a prompt, and strategies for effective prompt design.

title: AI Engineering by Chip Huyen: Chapter 2 Notes and Summary
excerpt: A summary of Chapter 2 from AI Engineering by Chip Huyen, covering foundation model design choices, pre-training and post-training processes, sampling methods, and the probabilistic nature of AI models.

title: Machine Learning Engineering by Andriy Burkov: Chapter 1 Notes
excerpt: Notes from Chapter 1 of Machine Learning Engineering by Andriy Burkov, discussing the process of solving practical problems using machine learning, including data collection, model training, and different learning paradigms.

title: RecMind: Large Language Model Powered Agent for Recommendation
excerpt: A summary of the RecMind paper, discussing the use of large language models as agents for recommendation systems, including architecture, advantages, challenges, and implementation patterns.

title: Topological Sort: All Possible Orders
excerpt: An explanation of topological sorting, including how to find all possible variations of task ordering given a set of prerequisites, with examples and complexity analysis.

title: Clean Code Concepts: Be SOLID: Open Closed Principle
excerpt: An exploration of the Open-Closed Principle, emphasizing designing classes that are open to extension but closed for modification, with examples in Java and Python.

title: Clean Code Concepts: Be SOLID: Single Responsibility Principle
excerpt: An exploration of the Single Responsibility Principle (SRP) in software development, with examples in Java and Python, emphasizing the importance of writing clean and maintainable code.

title: AI Engineering Book by Chip Huyen: Chapter 1 High level insights
excerpt: High-level insights from Chapter 1 of AI Engineering by Chip Huyen, discussing the scaling up of AI models, the importance of data, and challenges in building AI applications.

title: Exploring Vector Databases
excerpt: An exploration of vector databases, their use cases, and how they enable semantic search and similarity matching for AI applications.

title: Best Practices for Building Machine Learning Applications
excerpt: Practical guidelines and best practices for building production-ready machine learning applications, covering data, model development, deployment, and monitoring.

title: How to be a Better Backend Engineer
excerpt: Insights and advice on becoming a better backend engineer, covering system design, scalability, performance optimization, and best practices.

title: Writing your own Web server that can handle multiple connections
excerpt: A guide to building a web server from scratch that can handle multiple concurrent connections, covering networking, threading, and async programming concepts.

title: How to do large feature development?
excerpt: Strategies and approaches for managing large feature development in software engineering, including planning, breaking down work, and execution.

title: LRU Caches in Python
excerpt: An explanation of LRU (Least Recently Used) cache implementation in Python, including the functools.lru_cache decorator and custom implementations.

title: Emacs (spacemacs) Keybindings I use
excerpt: A personal guide to Emacs (Spacemacs) keybindings, covering various commands and shortcuts for efficient text editing and file management.
